discourse_list.title: A pioneer in Real-World Assets is gone

content.content: It is with a saddened heart that I’m sharing the news, @Philinje has left this world. Phil helped create the first Core Unit proposed on MakerDAO (Real-World Finance) and, as the lead on New Silver, made possible the first RWA loan from MakerDAO thanks to his real-estate knowledge. New Silver is still the biggest RWA borrower on MakerDAO to date. He also worked on FortunaFi and saw the value of having a senior position in the nascent space of revenue-based finance. Phil was a true pioneer and helped greatly the cause of RWA in DeFi. Moreover, he was also kind and good to people. He had great empathy and used it in deals to move forward in the interest of all parties. Phil was hard working. Revolutionizing RWA in DeFi with MakerDAO was only a part-time activity. Last summer, he joined IOHK as a product manager on Cardano. He never refused a challenge. My thoughts go toward his family.
SebVentures:  My thoughts go toward his family.   Rest in peace, @Philinje. Thanks for all your help.
My thoughts go toward his family.  @Philinje I will remember you!
Our sincerest condolences to @Philinje family. We have lost one of our own, too early. Rest In Peace Phil.

I have no words. Thank you @SebVentures for sharing this with us. My sincere condolences to Phil’s family, Although I have had limited interactions with Phil, I hope this will reach them. We are all humans among humans, and we should be closer to each other much more that what we do along the days. So long, Phil.
Such sad news ! Condolences for all the family, may you rest in peace @Philinje
Really sad news. RIP @Philinje  Thankful for all the contributions, my sincerest condolences to the family, friends, and coworkers for the loss. Thanks for sharing Seb.
Rest in peace @Philinje, thanks for all the good conversations around RWA. Condolences to his family.
Rest in peace @Philinje, my condolences to the family. It was great having you help us out and your contributions are eternalized here. Thank you for everything.

@SebVentures could you get in touch-  I am a close friend of Phil in London and am in contact with @Philinje 's family and we need to get in touch with Phil’s colleagues to help the family with admin following his passing.

So sad to get this news, RIP @Philinje. Phil was a good human being and cared deeply about DeFi. I am grateful that I had the opportunity to work with him. My heart goes out to his family and loved ones, you will be missed
Shocking. RIP @Philinje.  You made an impact on our community and you will be missed.
Very sad to hear this news. RIP

Shocked and deeply saddened by this news, was just talking to Phil the other day and was looking forward to collaborating with him on a new project. A true innovator and forward thinker in the space and always made the RWF team calls brighter with his presence. He will be deeply missed by the community and RWF team and my sincerest condolences go out to his family and friends. RIP Phil we will remember your contributions to RWF and MakerDAO!
Sad to see a brilliant mind and pillar of the community depart for the great beyond. Condolences to the family, RIP
Phil was such a great person and a pleasure to work with. His contributions to the RWA community were immense. My thoughts are with his family.
I’m so saddened to learn this. My thoughts go towards his family and loved ones.
I am going to miss Phil. My thoughts are with his grieving family.

I wished I have worked with @Philinje. I read his great work with other RWA MIP6 many times in order to understand what Maker really wants. It’s a shock to learn this sad news. Our thoughts are with his loved ones.

@Philinje was always kind and eager to contribute to the Maker vision. He will be missed dearly and will always remain as part of the MakerDAO family. Thank you @SebVentures for delivering the sad news.
Hi MakerDAO community For those who may want to watch the memorial service for Phil you can do so via this link at 10.30 GMT Friday 25th Feb     Best Regards Dan

For those that knew or worked with @Philinje For those that knew Phil Inje Chang Since our friend Phil Inje Chang’s passing on February 2nd of a heart attack,  he leaves behind his wife Naoko and their two beautiful girls. There is a GoFundMe page (Fundraiser by Kacie Leviton : In Loving Memory of Phil) to help cover funeral and unexpected costs, as well as a memorial site for anyone who would like to share photos and memories of Phil:
This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
